text: The 1936 Western Reserve Red Cats football team represented Western Reserve University in the American city of Cleveland, Ohio, now known as Case Western Reserve University, during the 1936 college football season. The team was coached by college football hall of fame coach Bill Edwards. Notable players included Frank "Doc" Kelker, Ray Zeh, Phil Ragazzo, Gene Myslenski, and Albie Litwak. The team went undefeated beating opponents by a combined 244-28, the defense posting six shutouts. The annual Thanksgiving Day rivalry game against Case was postponed due to heavy snow.https://www.newspapers.com/newspage/100330576/ ==Schedule== ==References== Western Reserve Category:Case Western Reserve Spartans football seasons Category:College football undefeated seasons Western Reserve football
